value.title: Manage software delivery by using a release based workflow on GitHub
value.excerpt: Learn to implement a release based workflow on GitHub using project boards, branches, and releases.

value.title: Run parallel tasks in Azure Batch with the Azure CLI
value.excerpt: Find out about the Azure Batch capabilities designed to help you efficiently run large-scale parallel and high-performance computing applications in the cloud.

value.title: SAP HANA on Azure Compute, Network, and Storage
value.excerpt: AP HANA on Azure (Large Instances) provides virtual machines for deploying and running SAP HANA. This module explores the SAP HANA on Azure (Large Instances) solution that builds on assigned, non -shared host/server bare -metal hardware.

value.title: Scan open source components for vulnerabilities and license ratings in Azure Pipelines
value.excerpt: Scan open-source components for security vulnerabilities and assess their license ratings when your application builds in Azure Pipelines.

value.title: Set up an IoT Edge Gateway
value.excerpt: This module is theoretical and will walk you through how an IoT Edge device can be used as a gateway.

value.title: Start the machine learning lifecycle with MLOps
value.excerpt: Learn enterprise AI management with our free open online course, including machine learning.

value.title: Synthesize Text Input to Speech
value.excerpt: Learn how to synthesize text to speech using the Speech-to-Text service.

value.title: Approach your data-flow diagram with the right threat model focus
value.excerpt: Threat modeling is an effective technique to help you identify threats and ways to reduce or eliminate risk. We start by deciding to focus on either what needs to be protected or who it needs protection from.

value.title: Create a threat model using data-flow diagram elements
value.excerpt: Data-flow diagrams are graphical representations of your system and should specify each element, their interactions and context.

value.title: Introduction to threat modeling
value.excerpt: Explore the four high-level steps of threat modeling.

value.title: Provide context with the right depth layer
value.excerpt: Threat models can get complex if all parties involved cannot agree on a data-flow diagram depth layer that provides enough context to satisfy requirements

value.title: Use containers for your Language Understanding Intelligent Service (LUIS) Apps
value.excerpt: The Language Understanding (LUIS) container loads your trained or published Language Understanding model. As a LUIS app, the docker container provides access to the query predictions from the container's API endpoints

value.title: Work with DataFrames columns in Azure Databricks
value.excerpt: Work with DataFrames columns in Azure Databricks

value.title: 60 seconds to a Linkerd service mesh on AKS | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: See just how easy it is to deploy a service mesh to your AKS cluster. William Morgan, maintainer of the open source service mesh Linkerd, joins Scott Hanselman to demonstrate just how easy it is to deploy Linkerd. Together they explore how to debug a live microservices application using the service mesh,

value.title: Azure Security Center – Just-in-Time Network Access
value.excerpt: Cloud hosted VM’s are prime targets for RDP and SSH brute force attacks because management ports are typically left in an open state. With Just in Time network access, you can put any of your ports, not just management ports, into a default deny state until a user requires access. Once access is requested,
